title: Can your main get banned for owning a bought or stolen account
body: Recently my friend bought a smurf account off a person and he wants to kno if his main can get banned for owning a smurf account that could have been stolen or scripted on. The reason I am asking this is because he does not want to ask him self and risking a ban so I'd thought I would ask for him.

replies.body: Please see Seras Dragon's reply, they are 100% correct that a sold account will be banned when discovered. Riot does not condone account purchasing, so if we feel it necessary to take action on their main account to dissuade them from continuing to breach the ToU we will.

Main won't be touched.

Bought account won't be touched if it was hand-leveled. If it was botted, it'll be banned in a few weeks, if you're lucky.

I bought a level 30 account in 2010 that was hand-levelled by Chinese farmers and it's still going today.

A bought account will always be banned as soon as it is noticed. The selling of accounts is against the ToS and faces consequences. If the account is ranked, the sooner it will see a ban, especially if your friend tries to play ranked on it. Expect the bought account to be short lived.

As for his main, there isn't much risk, usually that kind of association only goes down with boosters but even then it is difficult to definitively link accounts to one another (households, shared computers and so on as mentioned in comments below). That sad, it's very much a use at his own risk scenario. What he he has done is against the ToS and is 100% bannable, but as to whether any action would be taken against his main, that is a bit more uncertain, but definitely possible.

almost every bought account will have been levelled up by bots and so probably. Also yes all your accounts or at least accounts originating from the same ip and local computer id, addresses would get banned.
What happens if the account is like not levelled up with bots and is just an account that someone does not play on anymore can you get banned from that if they report you.
Sharing accounts is against terms and conditions, if the account doesn't slingshot between multiple people and hasn't used bots/scripts it wont get banned. And his main won't either.

They must've changed it since 2012. Probably when they revamped the support site (or whenever they done that).
Used to be able to share your account with family, just not ranked. One of my older accounts was played by like five other people. One of 'em got it banned, though.

Just told Riot that we were family and they lived in America and they said it was fine as long as it wasn't ranked. :x

It still is fine, and Riot won't ban that kind of account sharing. If it isn't playing ranked and the *account* isn't toxic/botting/scripting etc etc then it's in no danger.

The rule exists as an absolute to keep things simple. Because it's a ftp game, the vast majority of people wouldn't bother sharing an account and would just make their own, so really it's aimed at the majority of account sharing cases which fall into the "problematic" category. Saying flat out that account sharing is not allowed shuts the door on people that would try to skirt the line. 

Of course there will always be those with valid reasons to share an account with family or friends (limited money to spend on the game, limited time so shared to collect champions/runes etc) and Riot has no desire to go after these people.

Just as Riot can technically choose to ban anyone, they can also choose NOT to ban someone even if they have technically broken the ToS, though obviously, they only do such a thing in circumstances like yours (with the exception of the one that got it banned).
Sharing with family is something that is still against the ToS, but won't be actioned unless it is causing problems (e.g boosting).

No they only hand out those sorts of "Account wide" bans in extreme cases (Tyler1 for example) and even then they would have to know for sure they were connected. Tyler1 can still play because they don't do ip bans (a mishap a few years ago an ip ban got a whole dorm banned) its just if they find out he is playing on any account (see him streaming) he will be banned.

Your friend should be alright so long as nothing explicitly links him to that account but even if something does I think they would just ban the scripting account.
